flow-definition.description:
Job Description:
Use this job to build customzied docker image
Dockerfile need to be store on ConfigMap in Kubernetes.
Backend scripts will based on your input to find the target Dockerfile on specified namespace.
For example: IF you input Tenant=demo Namespace=default EnvName=qa In DockerImage you defined the search-app as below { "name":"search-app", "base":"xxxxx", // this is the base docker image tag, as default it will download docker image from <dockerRepo>/commerce/<name>:<base> "bundle": "xxxx", // this is customization package url, you can input a http://... link directly here or you can integrate with Nexus "version": "xxx" // this is the new docker image tag. For example. when finish build the docker image, it will be tag as <dockerRepo>/<Tenant>/search-app-cus:<version> and based on this docker image name to push to dockerRepo }
Backend scripts will try to find demoqa-search-app-dockerfile in namespace default
IF you specify the EnvType is auth
Backend scripts will try to find demoqaauth--search-app-dockerfile in namespace default
IF backend scripts can not find the target ConfigMap object which named as the dockerfile mentioned above.
It will demote to find ConfigMap object which named as high-level. For example, if can not find demoqaauth--search-app-dockerfile, Backend scripts will try to find demoqa--search-app-dockerfile. If still can not find demoqa--search-app-dockerfile Finally, if not Dockerfile can be found the Job will failed.
You also can specify the dockerfile name like this way to fix the logic just to find the target ConfigMap
{ "name":"search-app", "base":"xxxxx", "bundle": "xxxx", "version": "xxx", "dockerfile":"demoqa-search-app-dockerfile" }
Before you start to trigger this Job, please make sure you already create a Dockerfile ! You can create Dockerfile through ManageDockerfile_Base Job.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: Tenant
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description:
Input target group name here
Pipeline will based on the group name to fetch assets and push docker image

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: EnvName
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description:
current environment ( default value is empty )
IF you want to build environment specified docker image, you can input target environment name here The final docker image tag will compose as <version><env_name>

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: EnvType
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: you can build specific image for this envtype.

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: ForcePush_Image
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description: Define if need pipeline to push image to docker registry ( Default: False )

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: ForcePull_Image
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description: Define if need pipeline to pull image from docker registry for each build ( Default: False )

hudson.model.TextParameterDefinition.name: BuildInfo
hudson.model.TextParameterDefinition.description: Please provide images information you want to build base --> based OOB docker image ( the full name will be <docker repo>/<docker project name>/<current component>:<base> bundle --> customized bundle version ( the version you bundled on nexus ) version --> specify the new docker image tag, if empty, will use bundle version as tag for new docker image
